segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
My name is Catherine.
What's wrong, Catherine?
I'm just a little down today.
You're having a... you're mood... you're not in the mood today?
Is that what's going on?
I am not in the mood to record today.
Actually, no, I am in the mood.
So we're talking about moods, feelings, emotions.
segments.cn: 所以我们在谈论情绪、感觉、情感。

segments.en: This is today's podcast, and we're going to be learning a lot of the names for different kinds of feelings.
segments.cn: 这是今天的播客，我们将学习许多不同情感的名称。

segments.en: That's right, so you're going to learn how to describe what mood you're in.
segments.cn: 没错，所以你将学会如何描述你的心情。

segments.en: Maybe you're in a good mood, bad mood, etc.
segments.cn: 也许你心情很好，心情不好，等等。

segments.en: So let's just jump into the dialogue and see what's going on.
segments.cn: 那我们就直接进入对话，看看发生了什么。

segments.en: Are you okay?
You seem a bit anxious.
Yeah, I'm okay.
I've been having a lot of mood swings lately.
I think it has to do with the pills my doctor prescribed that are causing chaos on my hormones.
segments.cn: 我想这和我医生开的药有关，导致我的荷尔蒙混乱。

segments.en: So you mean you feel ecstatic one minute and then blue the next?
segments.cn: 所以你是说你一会儿很兴奋，一会儿又很沮丧？

segments.en: Yeah, it's weird.
For example, just this morning I was feeling detached and lonely, even though there was really no reason to feel that way.
segments.cn: 比如，就在今天早上，我感到孤立和孤独，尽管其实没有理由这样感觉。

segments.en: Well, maybe your mood will swing positively, and you will feel confident, brave, and hopeful.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许你的情绪会好转，你会感到自信、勇敢和充满希望。

segments.en: I hope you're right.
Okay, lots of feelings.
So many feelings, in fact, that we're going to talk about the names of them in today's language takeaway.
segments.cn: 事实上有这么多情感，以至于我们将在今天的语言学习中讨论它们的名称。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
So on language takeaway, let's take a look at this adjective.
segments.cn: 在语言学习中，让我们看看这个形容词。

segments.en: You are feeling or you seem a little bit anxious.
segments.cn: 你感到或看起来有点焦虑。

segments.en: Anxious.
He is anxious.
I feel anxious.
That's right.
Now this word means that you're feeling nervous or uneasy about something.
segments.cn: 这个词意味着你对某事感到紧张或不安。

segments.en: Normally when you feel anxious about something, like a test, all you can think about is the test.
segments.cn: 通常当你对某事感到焦虑时，比如考试，你脑海中只想着考试。

segments.en: Right.
Oh, will I fail?
What's going to happen?
Did I study enough?
You're worried.
So this is an anxious feeling.
segments.cn: 所以这是一种焦虑的感觉。

segments.en: That's right.
So if you're anxious, you're worried about something or you're nervous about something.
segments.cn: 所以如果你感到焦虑，你就是在担心某事或对某事感到紧张。

segments.en: It could be about your job, interview, a test, etc.
segments.cn: 这可能是关于你的工作、面试、考试等等。

segments.en: All right, so moving on now, we're feeling anxious, but then we also feel a different type of excitement.
segments.cn: 好的，接下来，我们感到焦虑，但我们也感到另一种兴奋。

segments.en: We are ecstatic.
All right, so while anxious is a bad feeling, ecstatic is a really good feeling.
segments.cn: 好的，所以焦虑是一种不好的感觉，而兴奋是一种非常好的感觉。

segments.en: Okay.
Okay, so I'm happy.
I'm really happy.
I'm ecstatic.
That's a really, really, really happy feeling.
segments.cn: 这是一种非常非常开心的感觉。

segments.en: Okay, so if you're ecstatic, it means you're very, very happy.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你感到兴奋，意味着你非常非常开心。

segments.en: So it's not a negative thing.
segments.cn: 所以这不是负面的事情。

segments.en: No, so when I get 100% on my test, I'm ecstatic.
segments.cn: 不，所以当我在考试中得了100分，我感到兴奋。

segments.en: I'm really happy.
Okay.
Now basically the complete opposite of being ecstatic would be to feel or be blue.
segments.cn: 现在，兴奋的完全相反就是感到沮丧。

segments.en: Yeah, this might seem a bit strange because blue is a color, as you know, B-L-U-E.
segments.cn: 是的，这可能看起来有点奇怪，因为蓝色是一个颜色，正如你所知道的，B-L-U-E。

segments.en: But when you're feeling blue, it means that you're feeling sad or down or upset.
segments.cn: 但当你感到沮丧时，意味着你感到悲伤或低落或不快。

segments.en: Yeah.
So maybe this is why you also have the music, the blues, right?
segments.cn: 所以也许这就是为什么你也有音乐，蓝调，对吧？

segments.en: The blues.
He's got the blues.
That means he's sad about something, usually a woman.
segments.cn: 这意味着他对某事感到悲伤，通常是关于一个女人。

segments.en: Aha, okay.
So ecstatic, very, very happy.
segments.cn: 所以兴奋，非常非常开心。

segments.en: Feeling blue, very, very sad.
segments.cn: 感到沮丧，非常非常悲伤。

segments.en: And well, another example of feelings, also a negative one, is if you feel detached.
segments.cn: 还有另一种情感的例子，也是负面的，就是如果你感到孤立。

segments.en: Detached.
All right.
So we know the word attach.
segments.cn: 所以我们知道“附加”这个词。

segments.en: That means to put two things together.
segments.cn: 这意味着把两个东西放在一起。

segments.en: Well, detached means to take two things apart.
segments.cn: 而“孤立”意味着把两个东西分开。

segments.en: Okay.
So what do you feel apart from?
Other people.
Okay.
So for example, if I'm feeling detached, maybe it means that I don't feel like the people around me understand me.
segments.cn: 所以例如，如果我感到孤立，可能意味着我觉得周围的人不理解我。

segments.en: I don't want to talk to other people.
I'm just not feeling very social.
So for example, can you feel detached in your relationship?
segments.cn: 所以例如，你可以在你的关系中感到孤立吗？

segments.en: You can, and that's actually a really bad feeling because you should be happy in a relationship.
segments.cn: 可以，这实际上是一种非常糟糕的感觉，因为你应该在一段关系中感到快乐。

segments.en: But when you're detached, it means that you don't really feel close to your boyfriend or girlfriend or husband or wife.
segments.cn: 但当你感到孤立时，意味着你并不真正感到和你的男朋友、女朋友或配偶亲近。

segments.en: Okay.
And we feel detached and lonely.
So if you feel lonely, that means that you feel?
segments.cn: 所以如果你感到孤独，意味着你感到？

segments.en: Similar to detached, lonely means that you don't feel like you can talk to anyone.
segments.cn: 类似于孤立，孤独意味着你觉得自己无法和任何人交谈。

segments.en: You feel alone.
You feel alone.
So I'm very lonely right now.
I have no one to talk to, no friends, you know, no one makes me feel good.
segments.cn: 我没有人可以交谈，没有朋友，你知道，没有人让我感觉好。

segments.en: Okay.
So that means that you feel alone.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着你感到孤单。

segments.en: All right.
A lot of adjectives.
There are many different ways to describe the way that you feel.
segments.cn: 有很多不同的方式来描述你的感觉。

segments.en: So let's take a listen to the dialogue again.
segments.cn: 所以让我们再听一遍对话。

segments.en: Are you okay?
You seem a bit anxious.
Yeah, I'm okay.
I've been having a lot of mood swings lately.
I think it has to do with the pills my doctor prescribed that are causing chaos on my hormones.
segments.cn: 我想这和我医生开给我的药有关，这些药让我的荷尔蒙失控。

segments.en: So you mean you feel ecstatic one minute and then blue the next?
segments.cn: 你是说你一会儿感到兴奋，一会儿又感到沮丧？

segments.en: Yeah, it's weird.
For example, just this morning, I was feeling detached and lonely, even though there was really no reason to feel that way.
segments.cn: 比如，就在今天早上，我感到孤立和孤独，尽管其实没有理由这样感觉。

segments.en: Well, maybe your mood will swing positively and you will feel confident, brave and hopeful.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许你的情绪会好转，你会感到自信、勇敢和充满希望。

segments.en: I hope you're right.
All right, we're back.
So now let's take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看流利度构建器。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
So on Fluency Builder today, the first phrase is mood swings.
segments.cn: 今天流利度构建器的第一个短语是情绪波动。

segments.en: I've been having a lot of mood swings lately.
That's right.
So this basically means that your mood is changing constantly all the time.
segments.cn: 这基本上意味着你的情绪一直在不断变化。

segments.en: That's right.
So your mood is the way that you feel.
segments.cn: 所以你的情绪就是你在某个时刻或某一天的感受。

segments.en: And to swing means to go back and forth.
segments.cn: 而波动意味着来回摆动。

segments.en: So I'm happy.
I'm sad.
I'm angry.
I'm, you know, lazy.
So these are mood swings.
And it means that you're not normal.
You're not flat.
You're going up and down and feeling many different things.
segments.cn: 你在上下波动，感受着许多不同的情绪。

segments.en: Okay, so to be clear, also mood, your mood is the way that you feel at a certain time or a certain day.
segments.cn: 好的，为了明确，情绪就是你在某个时刻或某一天的感受。

segments.en: That's right.
So you're in a good mood today.
Did you get good news?
That's right.
So that means that you look like you are happy, or it seems that your, I don't know, your personality is positive today.
segments.cn: 这意味着你看起来很快乐，或者说，你的，嗯，我不知道，你的个性今天很积极。

segments.en: That's right.
Or you could say, I'm in a bad mood.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，我心情不好。

segments.en: Don't talk to me.
So maybe you're angry.
All right.
Very good.
Now, when to basically explain why we're having these mood swings, we say that, well, maybe it has to do with the pills the doctor prescribed that are causing chaos on my hormones.
segments.cn: 现在，当我们基本上解释为什么我们会有这些情绪波动时，我们说，嗯，也许这和医生开给我的药有关，这些药让我的荷尔蒙失控。

segments.en: All right.
Chaos is a thing.
It's a noun.
And chaos means that there's no order.
Everything is crazy.
It's out of control.
And so basically what this person is saying is that the pills that he's taking, it can feel out of control.
segments.cn: 所以这个人基本上是在说他正在服用的药物让他感到失控。

segments.en: Right.
Exactly.
So they are causing chaos, to cause chaos, to cause nothing in control and on your hormones.
segments.cn: 所以它们造成了混乱，导致失控和荷尔蒙的波动。

segments.en: So, but what does hormones have to do with your mood?
segments.cn: 但是，荷尔蒙和你的情绪有什么关系？

segments.en: All right.
Hormones are chemicals that your body actually produces.
segments.cn: 荷尔蒙是你身体实际产生的化学物质。

segments.en: Women have different hormones from men, but they affect the way that we feel.
segments.cn: 女性的荷尔蒙与男性不同，但它们会影响我们的感受。

segments.en: So oftentimes you could say that I'm in a bad mood because of my hormones.
segments.cn: 所以你可以说，我心情不好是因为我的荷尔蒙。

segments.en: Pregnant women are very famous for having mood swings, happy, sad, angry, because they have more hormones in their bodies that they're not used to.
segments.cn: 孕妇因情绪波动而闻名，快乐、伤心、生气，因为她们体内有更多的荷尔蒙，她们不习惯。

segments.en: And so they cannot control the way that they feel.
segments.cn: 所以她们无法控制自己的感受。

segments.en: That's right.
So an example is if a man has too much of one hormone, like testosterone is a hormone, then this person will usually be very aggressive, right?
segments.cn: 所以一个例子是，如果一个男性有过多的某种荷尔蒙，比如睾酮是一种荷尔蒙，那么这个人通常会非常具有攻击性，对吧？

segments.en: That's right.
And the female counterpart to testosterone is estrogen.
segments.cn: 而睾酮的女性对应物是雌激素。

segments.en: So if you have too much estrogen, maybe you'll be a little bit too sensitive.
segments.cn: 所以如果你有过多的雌激素，也许你会变得有点过于敏感。

segments.en: Or emotional.
Or emotional.
That's right.
Okay.
So that's what we talk about chaos and hormones.
segments.cn: 所以这就是我们谈论混乱和荷尔蒙。

segments.en: Now, when we talked about mood swings, we take it as a noun, right?
segments.cn: 现在，当我们谈论情绪波动时，我们把它当作名词，对吧？

segments.en: You have mood swings.
But then at the end of the dialogue, we say, well, maybe your mood will swing positively.
segments.cn: 但在对话的最后，我们说，嗯，也许你的情绪会好转。

segments.en: So now we're talking, it's separate.
segments.cn: 所以现在我们在谈论，它是分开的。

segments.en: It's not a noun.
We're taking swing as a verb.
To swing.
That means, think about a pendulum.
segments.cn: 这意味着，想想一个摆锤。

segments.en: You know, a clock, it goes left and then swings right, then left.
segments.cn: 你知道，钟表，它向左摆动，然后向右摆动，再向左摆动。

segments.en: So we could talk about a mood like this.
segments.cn: 所以我们可以这样谈论情绪。

segments.en: So maybe your bad mood will swing the other way.
segments.cn: 所以也许你的坏情绪会向另一边摆动。

segments.en: Maybe it will become a good mood.
And so to swing here is the verb.
segments.cn: 所以这里的波动是动词。

segments.en: You can maybe try and encourage your mood to swing.
segments.cn: 你可以尝试鼓励你的情绪波动。

segments.en: Okay.
So to be clear, mood swings are a noun.
segments.cn: 所以为了明确，情绪波动是名词。

segments.en: But then in this last part, we put the verb to swing to kind of explain where mood swings comes from, right?
segments.cn: 但在最后这一部分，我们使用动词波动来解释情绪波动的来源，对吧？

segments.en: So the noun mood swings.
Now you understand that it's kind of like a pendulum and it's swinging back and forth and you're changing constantly.
segments.cn: 现在你明白这就像一个摆锤，它在来回摆动，你在不断变化。

segments.en: Exactly.
All right.
So let's take a listen to the dialogue one last time.
segments.cn: 所以我们最后再听一遍对话。

segments.en: Are you okay?
You seem a bit anxious.
Yeah, I'm okay.
I've been having a lot of mood swings lately.
I think it has to do with the pills my doctor prescribed that are causing chaos on my hormones.
segments.cn: 我想这和我医生开给我的药有关，这些药让我的荷尔蒙失控。

segments.en: So you mean you feel ecstatic one minute and then blue the next?
segments.cn: 你是说你一会儿感到兴奋，一会儿又感到沮丧？

segments.en: Yeah, it's weird.
For example, just this morning, I was feeling detached and lonely, even though there was really no reason to feel that way.
segments.cn: 比如，就在今天早上，我感到很孤独和疏离，尽管其实没有理由这样感觉。

segments.en: Well, maybe your mood will swing positively and you will feel confident, brave and hopeful.
segments.cn: 嗯，也许你的情绪会好转，你会感到自信、勇敢和充满希望。

segments.en: I hope you're right.
All right.
So talking about moods, now there are certain, well, maybe like conditions where your mood is negatively affecting your life.
segments.cn: 说到情绪，现在有些情况，可能是你的情绪对生活产生了负面影响。

segments.en: Like, for example, a person that suffers from anxiety.
segments.cn: 比如，一个有焦虑症的人。

segments.en: That's right.
So some people have anxiety disorders and this means that they're always worried about something, right?
segments.cn: 有些人有焦虑障碍，这意味着他们总是担心某些事情，对吧？

segments.en: You know, so they're always anxious, always anxious.
segments.cn: 你知道，他们总是感到焦虑，总是焦虑。

segments.en: So people who are anxious often tap their fingers or their pencils or their foot, talk quickly.
segments.cn: 所以焦虑的人常常会敲打手指、铅笔或脚，快速说话。

segments.en: So anxiety, it's not fun to feel anxious and you can only imagine.
segments.cn: 焦虑的感觉不好，你可以想象。

segments.en: So a lot of times these people who have anxiety problems, they will see their psychiatrist and they will try and get some medicine, some pills to help regulate their emotions, to help them feel in control.
segments.cn: 所以很多有焦虑问题的人会去看精神科医生，试图得到一些药物，帮助调节情绪，让他们感到掌控。

segments.en: So that I think is the most interesting thing for me is because your mood is actually very much dependent on what's going on chemically in your body.
segments.cn: 我觉得最有趣的是，你的情绪实际上很大程度上取决于你身体内的化学反应。

segments.en: So as you say, you could actually balance out maybe if you're feeling too anxious with drugs, you can actually make you feel less anxious because of the chemicals.
segments.cn: 正如你所说，如果你感到过于焦虑，药物可以帮助你减轻焦虑，因为化学物质的作用。

segments.en: Exactly.
And I think it's also important to remember that it's not just drugs that you take.
segments.cn: 我认为还要记住，不仅仅是你服用的药物。

segments.en: Sometimes people like to exercise and that helps them feel relaxed and calm because when you exercise, actually, your body produces certain chemicals that help you feel happy.
segments.cn: 有时人们喜欢锻炼，这有助于他们放松和冷静，因为当你锻炼时，身体会产生某些化学物质，让你感到快乐。

segments.en: Or when you eat.
Sometimes when you haven't eaten, you notice that you're very, very cranky.
segments.cn: 有时当你没吃东西时，你会发现自己非常烦躁。

segments.en: Oh, God, why are you doing this?
Why are you being like this?
And you eat and all of a sudden, oh, your body chemistry starts to change and so you feel better.
segments.cn: 然后你吃东西，突然间，你的身体化学开始变化，你感觉好多了。

segments.en: I heard that some people that suffer from anxiety disorders will be also compulsive eaters because they're nervous.
segments.cn: 我听说一些有焦虑障碍的人也会因为紧张而强迫性进食。

segments.en: So you know this, that some people eat when they're nervous.
segments.cn: 所以你知道，有些人在紧张时会吃东西。

segments.en: This is one of the side effects possibly, right?
segments.cn: 这可能是一个副作用，对吧？

segments.en: It is.
I've heard this too, that a lot of people who are nervous or who are anxious, they overeat.
segments.cn: 我也听说过，很多紧张或焦虑的人会过度进食。

segments.en: That means they eat too much.
segments.cn: 这意味着他们吃得太多。

segments.en: Even when they're not hungry.
Even when they're not hungry.
And this actually has a very large effect on your body because obviously, like I said, your body chemistry affects your mood.
segments.cn: 这实际上对你的身体有很大的影响，因为显然，正如我所说，你的身体化学影响你的情绪。

segments.en: So if you eat too much, your body maybe reacts negatively and you're even less happy.
segments.cn: 所以如果你吃得太多，你的身体可能会产生负面反应，你会更不快乐。

segments.en: It happens to me sometimes in the movie theater, like a really good scene or I'm nervous or there's an action sequence and I'm just eating that popcorn up and I'm already really, really thirsty, but I just can't stop.
segments.cn: 有时在电影院里发生这种事，比如一个很好的场景，或者我很紧张，或者有动作场面，我就不停地吃爆米花，尽管我已经非常口渴，但我就是停不下来。

segments.en: That's funny.
So if you have any questions or any other ways to describe feelings, maybe you could post them on our boards at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 如果你有任何问题或其他描述情感的方式，可以在我们的论坛上发布，地址是 EnglishPod.com。

segments.en: There are so many different feelings and most of them have words or names.
segments.cn: 有很多不同的情感，大多数都有词汇或名称。

segments.en: Look those up in your dictionaries and let us know.
segments.cn: 查查你的字典，告诉我们。

segments.en: All right, we'll see you guys there.
Bye.
